caption.p: Effects on life span, superoxide dismutase (SOD) level and methane dicarboxylic aldehyde (MDA) content in Drosophila melanogaster treated with or without red ginseng extract (RGE). (A) Life span curves of male flies feed with RGE. Wild type (circles): mean survival life span, 71.67 d; maximum life span, 79.8 d; RGE-treated (squares): mean survival life span, 80.7 d; maximum life span 93.8 d. In comparison to the wild type, RGE-treated flies had a 12.60% and 11.90% increase in mean and maximum life span, respectively. Life span curve was constructed with Prism 5 software and statistical significance was determined with log-rank test. Bar graphs of average level of SOD and average content of MDA were repeated three times and analyzed by Student t test. (B) Average level of SOD. (C) Average content of MDA. Data in this figure are shown as mean ± standard deviation. Statistical significance: ** p < 0.01 (RGE-treated vs. wild type).
